alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 8:27PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Santa Barbara. * WHEN...Until 300 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Roadway flooding is expected, especially in low lying and poor drainage areas. In addition, there is the risk of small stream flooding as well as rock and mudslide activity on canyon roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 817 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain across southern Santa Barbara county, heaviest in the Santa Ynez range and foothills. In addition, the cold front will bring moderate to heavy rainfall across the county through 3 am tonight. Rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.50 inches per hour will be common, with local rates of 0.50 to 1.00 inch per hour across foothill and coastal slope locations. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Santa Maria, Santa Barbara, Lompoc, Santa Ynez, Montecito, Carpinteria, Solvang, Vandenberg Air Force Base, El Capitan State Beach, Los Alamos and Summerland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
